acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 24-hour LC50=800mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna), and others (SIDS, 1996).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 5 based on rat LD50 value >2000mg/kg (SIDS, 1996).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Since there was description that there is almost no vapor pressures at 25degC (ICSC (J) (2003)), it was out of classification.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 4 baced on the LD50=386mg/kg which was calculated from the rat LD50s: 335mg/kg, 474mg/kg, 580mg/kg and 487mg/kg (SIDS, 1996) .

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility =820000mg/L(SIDS, 1996)) and acute toxicity is low.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Although it is combustible, UNRTDG is classified into 6.1 and III according to the UNRTDG No. (2659). Since 4.1 was not assigned, it was classified as out of Category.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not classified because of UNRTDG No. 2659, Class: 6.1, III (not Class: 4.2)

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In the teratogenicity study of the rat of SIDS (1996) of Priority 1 document, a fetal heart abnormality was increasing intentionally by the dose as which general toxicity (inhibitation of weight gains) is regarded to dam. So it was set as Category 2.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Not classified because of UNRTDG No. 2659 Class: 6.1, PG III (not Class: 4.2)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although SIDS (1996) had one positive report and one negative report in the eye irritation tests in rabbit, in ICSC (J) (2003) having description which stimulates the eye (redness, pain, haze eyes). So it is considered that it irritates to the eye mildly, it was classified into Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is a report that skin irritation was not indicated in the rabbit (SIDS (1996)), and it carried out the outside of Category. In addition, the data which is supported was not found although it was considered as those with skin irritation (Xi;R38) in EU-Annex I (Access on June 2005).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (the water solubility is obtained)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Because of the effects that were confirmed on livers and kidneys in the repeats oral administration tests with rats (SIDS (1996) and RTECS (1997)), and of their toxicologic amount of findings respectively, it was classified into Category 2 (liver, kidney).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 2 (central nervous system, heart, kidney),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause damage to organs (central nervous system, heart, kidney)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It was considered as Category 2, (a central nervous system, heart, kidney), Category 3 (respiratory irritant) based on the description that it effects on central nervous system, heart and the kidney in human and stimulates respiratory tract in ICSC (J) (2003) of Priority 2 document.
